title: Burberry sales slow on weaker Asia demand
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Wed, Jul 15, 2015, 08:48 BST - UK Markets close in 7 hrs 42 mins Burberry sales slow on weaker Asia demand By Elizabeth Anderson | Telegraph – 1 minute 53 seconds ago 0.0015 -0.0001 
The luxury retailer says sales in the lucrative Chinese market have slowed, but growth is strong in Europe and the Americas 
Sales of Burberry's synonymous trench coats and checked scarves remain strong, but overall sales at the luxury retailer slowed in the three months to the end of June. 
First (Other OTC: FSTC - news ) -quarter growth was 8pc, compared to growth of 11pc in the previous three months, due to weaker demand in Asia, the company said on Wednesday. 
Sales in Hong Kong and mainland China were weak compared to strong sales in Europe and America, although the company said Japan had seen "exceptional growth, albeit off a small base". 
Chief executive Christopher Bailey said: "While mindful that the external environment remains challenging, we will continue to focus on growth opportunities across channels, regions and products, with exciting plans for the year ahead." 
Burberry, known for its trademark camel, black and red checked print, reported revenue of £407m in the first quarter of its financial year. This compared to £370m a year ago, although was less than analyst forecasts of £414m. 
Burberry's tie-up with Cara Delevingne has boosted sales of cashmere scarves, perfume and coats 
At the company’s annual meeting in London on Thursday, the company is facing a rebellion from shareholders over the £7.9m pay package Mr Bailey received last year. 
Mr Bailey took over as chief executive from Angela Ahrendts in May 2014, combining it with his role as the company's creative director. 
The group reported pre-tax profits of £445m for the year ending March 31 , a 1pc fall on the year before. However, adjusting for currency movements, Burberry said that profits in its underlying business had risen by 7pc to £456m during the period.
